p.s: The article We are entering an era of pandemics - it will end only when we protect the rainforest was written by Peter Daszak, the president of the non-profit organization Eco-Health Alliance.
It was published on July 28th 2020 in the Guardian and deals with the topic of global pandemics being a result of humans interfering with eco systems, like the rainforest.
The point, Peter Daszak tries to bring acriss in his article is that every disease or virus, has it'sits beginning in the circle of nature.
He argues, that post global pandemics like Ebola or diseases like HIV had their origin in wild lifewildlife.
The global pandemic Covid-19 might have come from a wet market in China selling wild meat.

According to Daszak we are entering an era of pandemics, which resolutes through how we interact with our nature, for example by deforesting large parts of wild habitats and in that way increasing the risks of getting in direct contact with viruses that exist naturally in the animal world.
Daszak adds that the viruses and diseases themselves are not the problem when it comes to global pandemics.
He says that before there was a world, as globalized as today, pandemics would not have been a topic, because the chance of preading would have been limited to a small circle.
